channel.title: Updates on Dadgum Box Scores
channel.description: Recent content in Updates on Dadgum Box Scores

item.title: Update: Better tables
item.description: Update: Better tables, spelling errors, and filterable factors! We’re now using Bootstrap 4 and Datatables to host all the data. You’ll notice the tables are formatted slightly different, and the responsiveness is less confusing. If you’re still accessing the four factors on a mobile device, plan to use landscape. It will make it much easier to view the data. And while we’re mentioning the four factors, you’ll now find a search box to filter games and see the four factor data.

item.title: Update: Fouls, technicals, spreads
item.description: Update: Fouls, Technicals, Spreads There are new pages added to the referee or officials section of the site: fouls - shows officials and total fouls game-by-game since ‘03-04 technicals - shows any game with a technical foul (opponent or Carolina) in the Roy Williams era spread - shows the spread for all available games since ‘03-04, several games are unavailable This information is shared alongside the listed officials for each game.

item.title: Update: Four factors game-by-game, better mobile access
item.description: Update: Four factors for every game If you don’t know, the four factors explain why a team wins or loses. They’re the building blocks to efficiency. The four factors are: Shooting (eFG) Avoiding turnovers (TO%) Offensive rebounding (OR%) Getting to the foul line (FTRate) I’ve now added four factors and points-per-possession (PPP) for every game since 2003-04 on this page on the site. This was a tall task.

item.title: Update: Four factors, NBA draft picks, and more refs
item.description: Update: Four factors, more refs, and NBA players Did you know UNC was 11-3 last season when posting a higher turnover percentage than its opponent? It’s true, you can find that information here. Two of those wins came in the NCAA Championship run against Butler and Kentucky. Carolina could win games turning the ball over more often than its opponent because of its strength in the other three factors.

item.title: Update: Referees, officials, zebras
item.description: Update: Referees, officials, zebras How often UNC has seen a certain referee this season? I found myself asking this question when watching Carolina beat Florida State at home. Rather than track it in a Excel or CSV file, it sparked me to use dadgumboxscores.com to organize and easily find this information. So that’s what I did. You can now find a list of officials for every game played in the 2016–17 UNC season here: http://dadgumboxscores.
